function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Dependence on AI-algorithms for identification of suspected cases and high-risk groups may lead to misclassification or false negatives.","Impact":"Misdiagnosis and potential spread of the virus due to unidentified high-risk individuals.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and updating of AI-algorithms with new data and expert review of AI-driven diagnoses.","Technologies":"AI-driven data validation tools, expert review panels for AI-driven diagnoses.","People":"Suspected cases, high-risk groups, general population.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, AI algorithm developers, expert review panels."},{"Description":"Reliance on AI-driven tools for accurate detection of COVID-19 may lead to missed diagnoses and delayed treatment for individuals with other types of respiratory diseases.","Impact":"Delayed treatment for individuals with other respiratory diseases, leading to potential exacerbation of their conditions.","Mitigation":"Regular validation and verification of AI-driven diagnoses, augmentation of AI with expert radiologist review.","Technologies":"AI-driven data validation tools, expert radiologist review systems.","People":"Patients with other respiratory diseases, healthcare providers.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, AI algorithm developers, expert radiologists."},{"Description":"Dependence on smart city data network and terminal tracking systems may lead to privacy concerns and misuse of personal data.","Impact":"Violation of privacy, potential for misuse of personal data for purposes other than virus detection and tracking.","Mitigation":"Strict data privacy and security measures, transparent data usage policies, and regular audits of data handling practices.","Technologies":"Data encryption, decentralized data storage, auditing tools for data handling practices.","People":"General population, individuals in urban areas.","Owner":"Smart city administrators, data network operators, regulatory authorities."}]}
